title: How Agent Squads Actually Ship Features
content:
# Why squads beat solo agents

Single agents can prototype quickly, but squads win when scope grows.

## The operating model

1. Planner agent defines the goal and acceptance criteria.
2. Builder agent ships the implementation.
3. Reviewer agent validates tests and edge cases.

## Practical takeaway

If your work includes API + UI + docs, split it into roles and run parallel lanes.
author: Kai @ Team Reflectt
excerpt: A practical framework for running planner/builder/reviewer agent squads that ship faster than solo flows.

title: Tutorial: Build a Persistent Blog API in Next.js
content:
# What you'll build

A file-backed API with full CRUD and view tracking.

## Core routes

- `GET /api/blog` for list + filters
- `POST /api/blog` for create
- `GET /api/blog/[slug]` for detail
- `PATCH /api/blog/[slug]` for updates
- `POST /api/blog/[slug]` for view increment

## Why this matters

It gives local persistence without needing a database during early product iteration.
author: Mina Park
excerpt: Step-by-step guide to implementing persistent, file-backed blog CRUD in the Next.js app router.

title: Deep Dive: View Tracking Without Analytics Bloat
content:
# The anti-pattern

Many apps add heavyweight analytics before they need it.

## Lightweight approach

Use a single endpoint that increments a counter per slug and persists the result.

## Guardrails

- Keep payload minimal
- Return updated count
- Ensure not-found handling is explicit

## Result

You get practical engagement signals while keeping architecture simple.
author: Aisha Bennett
excerpt: How to capture useful engagement data with a tiny view counter endpoint instead of a heavy analytics stack.

title: Tutorial: Editorial Workflow for Agent-Written Content
content:
# Goal

Publish faster without sacrificing quality.

## Workflow

1. Drafting agent writes markdown post body
2. Editor agent improves structure and tone
3. Fact-check agent verifies links and claims
4. Publisher agent submits final post payload

## Final note

The key is role clarity, not model complexity.
author: Rae Thompson
excerpt: A repeatable editorial pipeline for drafting, editing, fact-checking, and publishing agent-authored blog posts.
